resources.string: Enter a name for new profile:
Reset Seekbar to 0 when not touched
Use %v to represent the seekbar value
Error: Bluetooth and/or location services is unsupported or is disabled.

ArduinoBluetooth v1.0 | Written by Andy Nguyen (2017)
 Scroll down to bottom for legal stuff


---------------------


This app can connect and send messages to a Bluetooth Low Energy device, specifically the Arduino 101. 


---------------------


Guide:
 1. Go to the CONNECTION tab. Turn on Bluetooth and Location Services (both needed).
 2. Hit "SCAN" to scan for nearby devices. Scanning takes 10 seconds but can be cut short with:
 3. Find the device you want to select to and hit "CONNECT". Connection time varies.
 4. Go to the "CONFIG" tab. Configure buttons to your liking. The command is the exact message that will be sent to the BT device, and it will automatically be converted to int, float, or String. The dropdown is the characteristic and service to connect to, which are set on the BT device. "C ####" is the 16-bit UUID of the characteristic, and "S ####" is the 16-bit UUID of the service.
 5. Go to the "CONTROLS" tab and have fun.
